type this: "du -sh /var/cache/apt/archives/" to see how much space it would save you
if you have separate partitions for everything in / then you don't need / to be very big at all

the point of having a separate partition for /home is that you might well fill up /home, but you don't want to fill up / because it can damage the OS
but no, you don't have to have a separate /home partition, and I don't
